okama.common package¶

Submodules¶

okama.common.helpers module¶

class okama.common.helpers.Date¶

Bases: object

static subtract_years(dt, years)¶

Subtract N years (integer) from a date. Used for time series. First month is +1 (if today is August the series should start at September to give 12 months).

class okama.common.helpers.Float¶

Bases: object

Group of methods using float values inputs. Some of them can take DataFrame also.

static annualize_return(rate_of_return, periods_per_year=12)¶

Annualizes a return. Default annualization is from month to year.

static annualize_risk(risk, mean_return)¶

Annualizes Risk. Annualization from month to year (from standard deviation) is by default. Monthly mean return is also required. Works with DataFrame inputs (in math.sqrt is not used).

static approx_return_risk_adjusted(mean_return, std)¶

Approximates geometric mean return given mean return and std.

static get_monthly_return_from_annual(annual_return)¶

Gets value of monthly return for a given annual return.

static get_purchasing_power(inflation, value=1000.0)¶
static get_random_weights(n, w_shape)¶

Produce N random normalized weights of a given shape.

class okama.common.helpers.Frame¶

Bases: object

Group of methods using DataFrame (or Series) input.

static change_columns_order(df, selected_columns, position='first')¶

Places selected_columns on the first position (position=’first’) or last position (position=’last’).

static get_annual_return_ts_from_monthly(ror_monthly)¶

Annual Rate of Returns time series from monthly data.

static get_cagr(ror)¶

Return Compound Annual Rate of Return (CAGR) for each asset given returns time series DataFrame.

static get_cumulative_return(ror)¶

Return Compound Return for time series of return (one or several).

static get_cvar_historic(ror, level=5)¶

Compute the Conditional VaR (CVaR) at a specified level.

static get_drawdowns(ror)¶

Get drawdowns from return time series.

static get_okid_index(rates, symbol)¶

Computes OKID index from bank rates time series. The index is a basket of 12 one year bank deposits (1 month shift). symbol is required for rates time series adjustments (for ‘RUS_RUB_TOP10.RATE’ it’s a different adjustment)

classmethod get_portfolio_mean_return(weights, ror)¶

Computes mean return of a portfolio (monthly).

classmethod get_portfolio_return_ts(weights, ror)¶

Returns the mean return time series given portfolio weights and the DataFrame of assets mean returns.

classmethod get_portfolio_risk(weights, ror)¶

Computes the std of portfolio returns.

static get_rolling_fn(ror, window, fn, window_below_year=False)¶
static get_semideviation(ror)¶

Returns semideviation for each asset given returns time series.

static get_var_historic(ror, level=5)¶

Compute monthly historic Value at Risk (VaR) at a specified level.

static get_wealth_indexes(ror, first_value=1000.0)¶

Returns wealth indexes for a list of assets (or for portfolio). Works also with pd.Series inputs.

static jarque_bera_dataframe(ror)¶

Jarque-Bera goodness of fit test on time series in form of Pandas DataFrame. The Jarque-Bera test shows whether the returns have the skewness and kurtosis matching a normal distribution.

Returns:

(The test statistic, The p-value for the hypothesis test) Low statistic numbers correspond to normal distribution.

static jarque_bera_series(ror)¶

Jarque-Bera goodness of fit test on a single time series (Pandas Series). The Jarque-Bera test shows whether the returns have the skewness and kurtosis matching a normal distribution.

Returns:

(The test statistic, The p-value for the hypothesis test) Low statistic numbers correspond to normal distribution.

static kstest_dataframe(ror, distr='norm')¶

Kolmogorov-Smirnov test for goodness of fit test on time series in form of Pandas DataFrame.

Returns:

(The test statistic, The p-value for the hypothesis test)

static kstest_series(ror, distr='norm')¶

Kolmogorov-Smirnov test goodness of fit test on a single time series (Pandas Series).

Returns:

{‘statistics’: The test statistic, ‘p-value’: The p-value for the hypothesis test}

static kurtosis(ror)¶

Calculate expanding Fisher (normalized) kurtosis time series. Kurtosis should be close to zero for normal distribution.

static kurtosis_rolling(ror, window=60)¶

Calculate rolling Fisher (normalized) kurtosis time series. Kurtosis should be close to zero for normal distribution. Window should be at least 12 months.

static skewness(ror)¶

Calculate expanding skewness. The shape of time series should be at least 12. In the opposite case empty time series is returned. TODO: implement skewtest (from scipy)

static skewness_rolling(ror, window=60)¶

Calculate rolling skewness. Window size should be at least 12 months.

static weights_sum_is_one(weights)¶
class okama.common.helpers.Index¶

Bases: object

static beta(ror)¶

Calculate beta coefficient time series. Index (or benchmark) should be in the first position (first column). The period should be at least 12 months.

static cov_cor(ror, fn)¶

Returns the accumulated correlation or covariance time series. The period should be at least 12 months.

static rolling_cov_cor(ror, window=60, fn='corr')¶

Returns the rolling correlation (or covariance) time series. The history period should be at least 12 months.

static tracking_difference(accumulated_return)¶

Returns tracking difference for a rate of return time series. Assets are compared with the index or another benchmark. Index should be in the first position (first column).

static tracking_difference_annualized(tracking_diff)¶

Annualizes the values of tracking difference time series. Annual values are available for periods of more than 12 months. Returns for less than 12 months can’t be annualized.

static tracking_error(ror)¶

Returns tracking error for a rate of return time series. Assets are compared with the index or another benchmark. Index should be in the first position (first column).

class okama.common.helpers.Rebalance¶

Bases: object

Methods for rebalancing portfolio.

static create_fn_list_ror_ts(ror, *, period='year')¶

Returns a list of functions of weights.

static rebalanced_portfolio_return_ts(weights, ror, *, period='year')¶

Returns mean return time series of rebalanced portfolio given returns time series of the assets. Default rebalancing period is a Year (end of year) For not rebalanced portfolio set Period to ‘none’

static rebalanced_portfolio_wealth_ts(weights, ror, *, period='year')¶

Returns wealth index time series of rebalanced portfolio given returns time series of the assets. Default rebalancing period is a Year (end of year) For not rebalanced portfolio set Period to ‘none’

okama.common.helpers.check_rolling_window(window, ror, window_below_year=False)¶
